Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.graph

Class AdjacencyMatrixGraph<V,​E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.graph.AbstractGraph<V,​E>
      • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.graph.AdjacencyMatrixGraph<V,​E>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of data in the vertices in the graph
    E - the type of data in the edges in the graph
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<V,​E>
    public class AdjacencyMatrixGraph<V,​E>
extends AbstractGraph<V,​E>
    An AdjacencyMatrixGraph is an implementation of the Graph abstract data type. AdjacencyMatrixGraph maintains a list of vertices in the graph and a list of edges in the graph. In addition, AdjacencyMatrixGraph maintains a 2-dimensional array to store edges based on the endpoints of the edges The AdjacencyMatrixGraph class is based on the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley & Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King

      • opposite

        public Graph.Vertex<V> opposite​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex,
                                Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        Returns the incident edge of a passed edge by comparing against the passed vertex param
        Specified by:
        opposite in interface Graph<V,​E>
        Overrides:
        opposite in class AbstractGraph<V,​E>
        Parameters:
        vertex - the passed vertex that will be compared against end point vertices to determine if an end point vertex is an incident edge
        edge - the edge which it's end points will be examined
        Returns:
        Vertex the vertex that is an incident edge (an end point vertex if it was able to be found)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an incident edge cannot be found

      • removeVertex

        public void removeVertex​(Graph.Vertex<V> vertex)
        Removes a vertex from vertex list and remove's it's outgoing and incoming edges connected to it's end point vertices All credit for this method goes to Griffin Bish NCSU 316 Student section 051 Summer 2022 Semester
        Parameters:
        vertex - the passed vertex (if it exists) who will be removed from vertex list including it's outgoing and incoming edges connected to it's end point vertices

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge​(Graph.Edge<E> edge)
        Removes an edge from edge list and updates graph edge matrix to reflect the removal of the edge removal
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge that will be removed and used to determine it's end point vertices and used to update matrix
